newsitem.title: CANADA: Placer sees no way to get into Busang.
newsitem.headline: Placer sees no way to get into Busang.

text.p: Gold miner Placer Dome Inc said Thursday that it was not drafting any new plans to join the Busang gold project in Indonesia because it sees no room for its involvement.
"We don't see an opportunity for a meaningful role...We don't see any way in for us," Placer chief executive John Willson told reporters in a conference call.

He cited as the main reason a deal annnounced Monday that awarded operatorship of Busang to Freeport-McMoRan Copper and Gold Inc. Placer wants control of the project and now finds the prospects unattractive, he said.

Placer earlier dropped its US$5 billion merger offer for Bre-X Minerals Ltd, which discovered the Busang deposit. Placer said the deal with Freeport, which halves Bre-X's stake in the property to 45 percent, diminished Bre-X's value.
Placer still views Busang, estimated to contain more than 70 million ounces of gold, as an attractive project.
Placer had lobbied hard to persuade the Indonesian government to allow open competitive bidding for Bre-X and Busang.
